intro: Hieracium grammolepium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained conditions. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium grammolepium is often found in temperate climates and can be an indicator species for certain ecological conditions.
